title: (x) Typewriter font in "Vitamin D - new perspectives in drawing" - Everson Mono {Angel}
content:
could someone help me in identifying this font?

[http://www.amazon.com/gp/reader/0714845450/ref=sib\_dp\_pt/105-2961714-427...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203174735/http:/www.amazon.com/gp/reader/0714845450/ref=sib_dp_pt/105-2961714-4278063#reader-link "http://www.amazon.com/gp/reader/0714845450/ref=sib\_dp\_pt/105-2961714-4278063#reader-link")

danke

 [‹ Need to ID these faces](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203174735/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38894 "Go to previous forum topic") [Armani Exchange Logo: Id please. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203174735/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38890 "Go to next forum topic")
author: johnniboy

comments.content: I really like this book and once googled the name of the designer. She has a website —-\> [http://www.juliahasting.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203174735/http:/www.juliahasting.com/ "http://www.juliahasting.com/"), under construction, but there’s a contact in the drop-down menu. It think this is the easiest/nicest way. Please post the ID (probably custom?), thanks.
Could be Everson Mono, although I can barely see the text in the balloons.

johnniboy,

Quoting her answer to my e-mail: “The font used in the book is a customized version of Everson Mono.”
